intro: Senecio simonsii, commonly known as Simons' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture. Senecio simonsii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
